definition: less serious case/in less severe cases

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: When cholera outbreak, the clinical manifestation weight varies, light easy to recover.
sentences.chinese: 霍乱发作时，临床表现轻重不一，轻者易愈。

sentences.english: The badly wounded take priority for medical attention over those slightly hurt.
sentences.chinese: 伤势严重者比轻者优先接受药物治疗。

sentences.english: Of two evils choose the least.
Symptoms can be mild, such as numbness in the limbs, or severe, such as paralysis or loss of vision.
sentences.chinese: 症状轻者诸如肢体僵硬，重则瘫痪或失明。

definition: so much so that/to the extent that/even
to such an extent as to/down to/up to
slow and patient/chronic (disease)/slow to take effect (e.g. a slow poison)
to make heavier/to emphasize/(of an illness etc) to become more serious/to aggravate (a bad situation)/to increase (a burden, punishment etc)
to lead to death/to result in death
